application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Maple tree is situated within the parking area at the front of Rosecroft Court, and is part of a line of trees which provides a green screen to the residents of Rosecroft Court from the road traffic and noise pollution of the adjacent Ducks Hill Road. This line of trees is clearly visible from Ducks Hill Road, The Avenue and Mallard Way, and has a moderate amenity value for the dwellers of these roads.

The applicant has submitted an inconsistent application; it is proposed that pruning of the branch tip endings is carried out on One Sycamore within the parking area in Rosecroft Court. A map is provided to help identify the tree, but neither the species description nor the map are consistent with the species growing within Rosecroft Court and their location.
As a result we are unable to fully ascertain which tree/s the applicant wishes to carry out work on and therefore we cannot determine the suitability of this application.
Having regard to the reasons given for the proposed wo
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981:  Note that it is an offence under this act to disturb roosting bats, nesting birds or any other protected species.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
description: To carry out tree surgery including to cut back the branch tip endings to attain 5.2m ground clearance over the car park this will reduce the width from 8m wide to 6m wide for the sector over the car park only. Branch tip endings only to be reduced to attain the lift, to One Maple T7 on TPO 41
